treatment.description: Leaves: petiole densely short stipitate-glandular; blade sur-faces densely short stipitate-glandular, hairs to 0.6 mm. Hypanthia densely short stipitate-glandular. 2n = 14.
treatment.habitat: Shaded or north-facing sandstone or limestone ledges or rock undercuts
treatment.discussion: Variety puberula is uniformly short stipitate-glandular and is mostly restricted to the Ozark Mountains of Arkansas and Missouri, plus sites in central Kentucky and southern Indiana.
